"Discovery"
Winter-Quarters
Feb 26th. 1903

Summary of S.W. Sledge trip Dec 20th. 1902-Jan 30.th 1903.
Left Discovery Dec 20th. 1902 with 4[Text?] & 1 Stoker, 2 tents, 2 Sledges, & 5 weeks provisions (1 week at Depot-A) & 1 weeks bay for Soultere party. Total wt. 1148lbs.
Arrived at-Depot-A Dec. 31st 1902
Left-       "    " Jan 1st. 1903

Winter Quarters¶¶
Feb 26<sup>th<sup>.1903.¶¶
Summary of S.W. sledge trip Dec 20 <sup>th<sup>.1902 - Jan 30<sup>th<sup> 1903.¶¶

Left Discovery Dec 20<sup>th<sup>. 1902 with 4 seaman & 1 stoker, 2 tents, 2 sledges,¶ 
& 5 weeks provisions (1 week at Depot-A) & 1 weeksday for Southern party total w.[text?]1148lbs.¶¶ 
Arrived at Depot-A Dec.31<sup>st<sup>1902¶¶
Left "  " Jan 1<sup>st<sup>.1903¶¶
Travelling towards Southern visible land, and altering course to South¶
to clear each successive [text?] of land as it appeared above the horizon.¶
Passed 2 gaps or [text?] in the coast, beyond which to westward)¶
was an apparently flat-horizon., land [text?] to Southward.¶¶

"Discovery"¶¶
Winter Quarters¶¶
Feb 26<sup>th<sup>.1903.¶¶
Summary of S.W. sledge trip Dec 20 <sup>th<sup>.1902 - Jan 30<sup>th<sup> 1903.¶¶

Left Discovery Dec 20<sup>th<sup>. 1902 with 4 seaman & 1 stoker, 2 tents, 2 sledges,¶ 
& 5 weeks provisions (1 week at Depot-A) & 1 weeks bag for Southern party total wt. 1148lbs.¶¶ 
Arrived at Depot-A Dec.31<sup>st<sup>1902¶¶
Left "  " Jan 1<sup>st<sup>.1903¶¶
Travelling towards Southern visible land, and altering course to South¶
to clear each successive 
rise of land as it appeared above the horizon.¶
Passed 2 gaps or straits  in the coast, beyond which to westward)¶
was an apparently flat-horizon., land extending  to Southward.¶¶
On Jan 14th., having been out 14 days from the Depot A, we turned 
back, the weather having been very thick for the last two days, and being very 
thick at the time, having got abreast of the southern of the 2 gaps we saw.
Weather remained thick with the exception of two days, when a short 
view of bits of the land was obtained, till the 24th. when it cleared, and on the 
evening of which day, we reached Depot A.
Reached the ship on Jan 30th.
———
On the way out, on Dec 28th., we crossed the fresh track of a single Adelie pen-
guin travelling E, having apparently come from between Mt. Discovery & Black Sd.
and on the way home, we crossed the track of another one, a few miles further 
North and going in about the same direction.
Got rounds of angles & bearings nearly every day till Jan 15th., when we 
had started back. After that date, the weather was thick till the 26th, 28th & 29th 
on which dates I got rounds of angles.
The health of the party was good. Everyone wore goggles all the time, and I 
did not have occasion for any medical treatment.
Michael Barne
<u>Lieut RN<\u>
